text: Interestingly , all of those events were largely indirect and mediated by endogenously secreted <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , as they were strongly inhibited by a neutralizing anti - <extra_id_0> TNF alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> monoclonal antibody .

Furthermore , cyclosporin A , which blocked <extra_id_0> TNF alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production induced by PKC , strongly inhibited <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NF.kappa B activation .

text: Those results indicate that , in resting T cells , PKC activation has only a triggering role , whereas the endogenously secreted <extra_id_0> TNF alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays an essential role in the quantitative control of the expression of <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or NF.kappa B activation .
